OMNI.Name: Spacecraft ID (Plasma)
OMNI.LongDescription: OMNI ID code for the source spacecraft for time-shifted IP plasma values (see OMNI documentation link for codes)

OMNI.Name: ae (Omni)
OMNI.LongDescription: AE - 5-minute AE-index, from WDC Kyoto (Final 1988/001-1988/182, Provisional 1990/001-2019/365)

OMNI.Name: AL (Omni)
OMNI.LongDescription: AL - 5-minute AL-index, from WDC Kyoto (Final 1988/001-1988/182, Provisional 1990/001-2019/365)

OMNI.Name: |avg B|
OMNI.LongDescription: Magnitude of avg. field vector (nT) (last currently-available OMNI B-field data Mar 10, 2024)

OMNI.Name: Proton density (n/cc)
OMNI.LongDescription: Proton density (n/cc) (last currently-available OMNI plasma data Mar 10,2024)

OMNI.Name: Bx GSM
OMNI.LongDescription: Bx (nT), GSM, determined from post-shift GSE components

OMNI.Name: By GSM
OMNI.LongDescription: By (nT), GSM, determined from post-shift GSE components

OMNI.Name: Bz GSM
OMNI.LongDescription: Bz (nT), GSM, determined from post-shift GSE components

OMNI.Name: Bow Shock Nose Position x
OMNI.LongDescription: Bow Shock Nose (Re) location, X, GSE

OMNI.Name: Bow Shock Nose Position y
OMNI.LongDescription: Bow Shock Nose (Re) location, Y, GSE

OMNI.Name: Bow Shock Nose Position z
OMNI.LongDescription: Bow Shock Nose (Re) location, Z, GSE

OMNI.Name: # fine scale IMF points
OMNI.LongDescription: Number of fine time scale points in IMF averages

OMNI.Name: # fine scale Plasma points
OMNI.LongDescription: Number of fine time scale points in plasma averages

LASP.Name: F30 (LASP)
LASP.LongDescription: 30cm Absolute Solar Radio Flux (solar flux unit (SFU))

BERNESE.Name: X_EF
BERNESE.LongDescription: Satellite X position in Earth-fixed frame

BERNESE.Name: Y_EF
BERNESE.LongDescription: Satellite Y position in Earth-fixed frame

BERNESE.Name: Z_EF
BERNESE.LongDescription: Satellite Z position in Earth-fixed frame

BERNESE.Name: VX_EF [m/s]
BERNESE.LongDescription: Satellite velocity in Earth-fixed frame (HWM applied)

BERNESE.Name: VY_EF [m/s]
BERNESE.LongDescription: Satellite velocity in Earth-fixed frame (HWM applied)

BERNESE.Name: VZ_EF [m/s]
BERNESE.LongDescription: Satellite velocity in Earth-fixed frame (HWM applied)

STL.Name: trend
STL.LongDescription: STL Trend (every 14 days where possible, or max possible where inbetween maneuvers)

STL.Name: residual
STL.LongDescription: STL Residual (every 14 days where possible, or max possible where inbetween maneuvers)

STL.Name: unresolved
STL.LongDescription: STL Trend + Residual (every 14 days where possible, or max possible where inbetween maneuvers)

STL.Name: seasonal_1
STL.LongDescription: STL Seasonal 1 (every 14 days where possible, or max possible where inbetween maneuvers)

STL.Name: seasonal_2
STL.LongDescription: STL Seasonal 2 (every 14 days where possible, or max possible where inbetween maneuvers)

STL.Name: seasonal_3
STL.LongDescription: STL Seasonal 3 (every 14 days where possible, or max possible where inbetween maneuvers)

STL.Name: seasonal_4
STL.LongDescription: STL Seasonal 4 (every 14 days where possible, or max possible where inbetween maneuvers)

STL.Name: mean_altitude
STL.LongDescription: Mean altitude (STL trend reduced by the radius of the Earth)

DECAY RATES.Name: slope
DECAY RATES.LongDescription: Slope of the 24h linear regression (equivalent to orbital decay rate)

DECAY RATES.Name: res_std
DECAY RATES.LongDescription: Standard deviation of the residuals of the 24h linear regression

DECAY RATES.Name: se_orbital_decay
DECAY RATES.LongDescription: Standard error of the orbital decay rate

MANEUVER FLAGS.Name: is_missing_day
MANEUVER FLAGS.LongDescription: Is missing day in bernese ele files

MANEUVER FLAGS.Name: is_outlier_maneuver_day
MANEUVER FLAGS.LongDescription: Maneuver inducing more than 5km orbital decay

MANEUVER FLAGS.Name: is_maneuver_day_extended
MANEUVER FLAGS.LongDescription: Is maneuver day extended (+-12h around maneuver days)

MANEUVER FLAGS.Name: is_missing_day_extended
MANEUVER FLAGS.LongDescription: Is missing day extended (+-12h around missing days)

OTHER NOTES.Name: columns with _c
OTHER NOTES.LongDescription: columns with _c are the columns that have been corrected for maneuver times (i.e. set to nan during is_maneuver_period_generic)
